title: Funeral March for the Minimal Man
text: Peppered with bizarre and medieval-looking creatures, Funeral March for the Minimal Man is part of a long art-historical tradition of the grotesque, as found in the drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci and paintings of Hieronymous Bosch. The artist, who is self-taught and based in Minneapolis, makes use of fantastical imagery in his work in order to comment directly on the mental health profession.
description: monsterous, deformed, doll-like figures, with one figure strapped to a wheelchair at center and a skeleton headed figure in URC; worn buildings at L; greenish grey turbulent sky
